page.title: 19AN OLD HOUSE
page.content: The house itself was apparently divided into three dwellings and it has three front and three rear doors and seven seperate fireplaces. Renovation works carried out since the purchase have revealed that although much of the interior timberwork-the ceiling beams and the big inglenook for example are certainly mid to late Tudor it is probable that the original structure of the house is possibly late Saxon.As such it was almost certainly a open-hall type house with an upstairs stocar at the south end only,where there is a stone fireplace in the main front bedroom.At the north end there was originally not an inglenook but merely a smoke-bay.The main timbers here are extensively blackened and slightly charred under the gable.
